summary: The Native American Entrepreneurial and Opportunity Act of 2025 aims to establish an Office of Native American Affairs within the Small Business Administration (SBA). This office will focus on providing entrepreneurial development, contracting, and capital access programs to Native American Tribes and Native Hawaiian Organizations. The bill outlines the responsibilities of the Associate Administrator, including outreach, policy development, and grant distribution. Further, It mandates the office connect these groups with relevant programs across other federal agencies and authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2030.
